metadata.title: CVE-2023-52661 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/tegra: rgb: Fix missing clk_put() in the error handling paths oftegra_dc_rgb_probe() If clk_get_sys(..., "pll_d2_out0") fails, theclk_get_sys() call must be undone. Add the missing clk_put and a new'put_pll_d_out0' label in the error handling path, and use it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52661` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic-64k - 6.8.0-35.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1009-aws - 6.8.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-gcp - 6.8.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-ibm - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency - 6.8.0-35.35.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-35.35.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1005-raspi - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oem - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required
